meanings.definition: To repair the heel of a shoe.
meanings.sent1: She carefully reheels her favorite boots to make them look new again.
meanings.sent2: After years of use, it's time to reheels my old shoes to make them wearable.
meanings.sent3: He tried to reheels his sneakers with duct tape, but it didn't work out well.
meanings.sent4: The cobbler skillfully reheels the worn-out shoes, making them sturdy once more.
meanings.sent5: Watching the cobbler reheels the shoes is like witnessing a magical transformation.

meanings.definition: To put heels back on shoes.
meanings.sent1: I need to reheels my favorite pumps before the party tonight.
meanings.sent2: She always reheels her shoes herself to save money on repairs.
meanings.sent3: He decided to reheels his boots at home using a DIY kit.
meanings.sent4: The shoemaker can reheels any type of shoe with precision and care.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the hammer as he reheels the shoes echoes through the workshop.

meanings.definition: To regain one's balance or composure.
meanings.sent1: After stumbling, she quickly reheels herself and continues walking.
meanings.sent2: He took a deep breath to reheels before giving his important presentation.
meanings.sent3: Trying to reheels after the embarrassing fall, he ended up tripping again.
meanings.sent4: She reheels her emotions and faces the challenge with determination.
meanings.sent5: In moments of chaos, it's essential to reheels and stay focused on the goal.
